member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsConverter
member.summary: The serialization converter allows for customization of the serialization process.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsBaseConverter
member.summary: The serialization converter allows for customization of the serialization process.
member.remarks: You do not want to derive from this class - there is no way to actually use it within the serializer.. Instead, derive from either fsConverter or fsDirectConverter

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsBaseConverter.Serializer
member.summary: The serializer that was owns this converter.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsBaseConverter.CreateInstance(DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData,System.Type)
member.summary: Construct an object instance that will be passed to TryDeserialize. This should **not** deserialize the object.
member.param: The data the object was serialized with.
The field/property type that is storing the instance.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsBaseConverter.RequestCycleSupport(System.Type)
member.summary: If true, then the serializer will support cyclic references with the given converted type.
member.param: The field/property type that is currently storing the object that is being serialized.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsBaseConverter.RequestInheritanceSupport(System.Type)
member.summary: If true, then the serializer will include inheritance data for the given converter.
member.param: The field/property type that is currently storing the object that is being serialized.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsBaseConverter.TrySerialize(System.Object,DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData@,System.Type)
member.summary: Serialize the actual object into the given data storage.
member.param: The object instance to serialize. This will never be null.
The serialized state.
The field/property type that is storing this instance.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsBaseConverter.TryDeserialize(DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData,System.Object@,System.Type)
member.summary: Deserialize data into the object instance.
member.param: Serialization data to deserialize from.
The object instance to deserialize into.
The field/property type that is storing the instance.
member.returns: True if serialization was successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsConverter.CanProcess(System.Type)
member.summary: Can this converter serialize and deserialize the given object type?
member.param: The given object type.
member.returns: True if the converter can serialize it, false otherwise.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsDateConverter
member.summary: Supports serialization for DateTime, DateTimeOffset, and TimeSpan.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsEnumConverter
member.summary: Serializes and deserializes enums by their current name.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsEnumConverter.ArrayContains``1(``0[],``0)
member.summary: Returns true if the given value is contained within the specified array.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsGuidConverter
member.summary: Serializes and deserializes guids.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsIEnumerableConverter
member.summary: Provides serialization support for anything which extends from `IEnumerable` and has an `Add` method.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsIEnumerableConverter.GetElementType(System.Type)
member.summary: Fetches the element type for objects inside of the collection.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsNullableConverter
member.summary: The reflected converter will properly serialize nullable types. However, we do it here instead as we can emit less serialization data.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsWeakReferenceConverter
member.summary: Serializes and deserializes WeakReferences.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsConverterRegistrar
member.summary: This class allows arbitrary code to easily register global converters. To add a converter, simply declare a new field called "Register_*" that stores the type of converter you would like to add. Alternatively, you can do the same with a method called "Register_*"; just add the converter type to the `Converters` list.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsDirectConverter
member.summary: The direct converter is similar to a regular converter, except that it targets specifically only one type. This means that it can be used without performance impact when discovering converters. It is strongly recommended that you derive from fsDirectConverter{TModel}.
member.remarks: Due to the way that direct converters operate, inheritance is *not* supported. Direct converters will only be used with the exact ModelType object.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsAotCompilationManager
member.summary: The AOT compilation manager

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsAotCompilationManager.TryToPerformAotCompilation(System.Type,System.String@)
member.summary: This is a helper method that makes it simple to run an AOT compilation on the given type.
member.param: The type to perform the AOT compilation on.
The AOT class. Add this C# code to your project.
member.returns: True if AOT compilation was successful.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsAotCompilationManager.AddAotCompilation(System.Type,DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new AOT compilation unit.
member.param: The type of object we are AOT compiling.
The members on the object which will be serialized/deserialized.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsAotCompilationManager.GenerateDirectConverterForTypeInCSharp(System.Type,DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: AOT compiles the object (in C#).

member.name: P:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsAotCompilationManager.AvailableAotCompilations
member.summary:
Ahead of time compilations that are available. The type maps to the object type the generated converter will serialize/deserialize, and the string is the text content for a converter that will do the serialization.
The generated serializer is completely independent and you don't need to do anything. Simply add the file to your project and it'll get used instead of the reflection based one.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsConfig
member.summary: Enables some top-level customization of Full Serializer.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsConfig.SerializeAttributes
member.summary: The attributes that will force a field or property to be serialized.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsConfig.IgnoreSerializeAttributes
member.summary: The attributes that will force a field or property to *not* be serialized.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsConfig.SerializeNonAutoProperties
member.summary: Should the default serialization behaviour include non-auto properties?

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsConfig.SerializeNonPublicSetProperties
member.summary: Should the default serialization behaviour include properties with non-public setters?

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsConfig.IsCaseSensitive
member.summary: Should deserialization be case sensitive? If this is false and the JSON has multiple members with the same keys only separated by case, then this results in undefined behavior.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsConfig.CustomDateTimeFormatString
member.summary: If not null, this string format will be used for DateTime instead of the default one.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsConfig.Serialize64BitIntegerAsString
member.summary: Int64 and UInt64 will be serialized and deserialized as string for compatibility

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsConfig.SerializeEnumsAsInteger
member.summary: Enums are serialized using their names by default. Setting this to true will serialize them as integers instead.

member.name: P:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsConfig.DefaultMemberSerialization
member.summary: The default member serialization.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData
member.summary: A union type that stores a serialized value. The stored type can be one of six different types: null, boolean, double, Int64, string, Dictionary, or List.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData._value
member.summary: The raw value that this serialized data stores. It can be one of six different types; a boolean, a double, Int64, a string, a Dictionary, or a List.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsIgnoreAttribute
member.summary: The given property or field annotated with [JsonIgnore] will not be serialized.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsISerializationCallbacks
member.summary: Extend this interface on your type to receive notifications about serialization/deserialization events. If you don't have access to the type itself, then you can write an fsObjectProcessor instead.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsISerializationCallbacks.OnBeforeSerialize(System.Type)
member.summary: Called before serialization.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsISerializationCallbacks.OnAfterSerialize(System.Type,DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData@)
member.summary: Called after serialization.
member.param: The field/property type that is storing the instance.
The data that was serialized.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsISerializationCallbacks.OnBeforeDeserialize(System.Type,DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData@)
member.summary: Called before deserialization.
member.param: The field/property type that is storing the instance.
The data that will be used for deserialization.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsISerializationCallbacks.OnAfterDeserialize(System.Type)
member.summary: Called after deserialization.
member.param: The field/property type that is storing the instance.
The type of the instance.

summary.para: Enables injecting code before/after an object has been serialized. This is most useful if you want to run the default serialization process but apply a pre/post processing step.

Multiple object processors can be active at the same time. When running they are called in a "nested" fashion - if we have processor1 and process2 added to the serializer in that order (p1 then p2), then the execution order will be p1#Before p2#Before /serialization/ p2#After p1#After.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsObjectProcessor.CanProcess(System.Type)
member.summary: Is the processor interested in objects of the given type?
member.param: The given type.
member.returns: True if the processor should be applied, false otherwise.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsObjectProcessor.OnBeforeSerialize(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Called before serialization.
member.param: The field/property type that is storing the instance.
The type of the instance.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsObjectProcessor.OnAfterSerialize(System.Type,System.Object,DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData@)
member.summary: Called after serialization.
member.param: The field/property type that is storing the instance.
The type of the instance.
The data that was serialized.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsObjectProcessor.OnBeforeDeserialize(System.Type,DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData@)
member.summary: Called before deserialization.
member.param: The field/property type that is storing the instance.
The data that will be used for deserialization.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsObjectProcessor.OnBeforeDeserializeAfterInstanceCreation(System.Type,System.Object,DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData@)
member.summary: Called before deserialization has begun but *after* the object instance has been created. This will get invoked even if the user passed in an existing instance.
member.remarks: **IMPORTANT**: The actual instance that gets passed here is *not* guaranteed to be an a subtype of storageType, since the value for instance is whatever the active converter returned for CreateInstance() - ie, some converters will return dummy types in CreateInstance() if instance creation cannot be separated from deserialization (ie, KeyValuePair).
member.param: The field/property type that is storing the instance.
The created object instance. No deserialization has been applied to it.
The data that will be used for deserialization.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsObjectProcessor.OnAfterDeserialize(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Called after deserialization.
member.param: The field/property type that is storing the instance.
The type of the instance.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsMemberSerialization
member.summary: Controls how the reflected converter handles member serialization.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsMemberSerialization.OptIn
member.summary: Only members with [SerializeField] or [fsProperty] attributes are serialized.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsMemberSerialization.OptOut
member.summary: Only members with [NotSerialized] or [fsIgnore] will not be serialized.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsMemberSerialization.Default
member.summary: The default member serialization behavior is applied.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsObjectAttribute
member.summary: This attribute controls some serialization behavior for a type. See the comments on each of the fields for more information.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsObjectAttribute.PreviousModels
member.summary: The previous model that should be used if an old version of this object is encountered. Using this attribute also requires that the type have a public constructor that takes only one parameter, an object instance of the given type. Use of this parameter *requires* that the VersionString parameter is also set.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsObjectAttribute.VersionString
member.summary: The version string to use for this model. This should be unique among all prior versions of this model that is supported for importation. If PreviousModel is set, then this attribute must also be set. A good valid example for this is "v1", "v2", "v3", ...

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsObjectAttribute.MemberSerialization
member.summary: This controls the behavior for member serialization. The default behavior is fsMemberSerialization.Default.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsObjectAttribute.Converter
member.summary: Specify a custom converter to use for serialization. The converter type needs to derive from fsBaseConverter. This defaults to null.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsObjectAttribute.Processor
member.summary: Specify a custom processor to use during serialization. The processor type needs to derive from fsObjectProcessor and the call to CanProcess is not invoked. This defaults to null.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsPropertyAttribute
member.summary: Explicitly mark a property to be serialized. This can also be used to give the name that the property should use during serialization.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsPropertyAttribute.Name
member.summary: The name of that the property will use in JSON serialization.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult
member.summary: The result of some sort of operation. A result is either successful or not, but if it is successful then there may be a set of warnings/messages associated with it. These warnings describe the performed error recovery operations.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult._success
member.summary: Is this result successful?
member.remarks: This is intentionally a `success` state so that when the object is default constructed it defaults to a failure state.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult._messages
member.summary: The warning or error messages associated with the result. This may be null if there are no messages.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult.AddMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new message to this result.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult.AddMessages(DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult)
member.summary: Adds only the messages from the other result into this result, ignoring the success/failure status of the other result.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult.Merge(DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult)
member.summary: Merges the other result into this one. If the other result failed, then this one too will have failed.
member.remarks: Note that you can use += instead of this method so that you don't bury the actual method call that is generating the other fsResult.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult.Success
member.summary: A successful result.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult.Warn(System.String)
member.summary: Create a result that is successful but contains the given warning message.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult.Fail(System.String)
member.summary: Create a result that failed.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult.op_Addition(DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult,DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult)
member.summary: Only use this as +=!

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult.AssertSuccess
member.summary: A simply utility method that will assert that this result is successful. If it is not, then an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult.AssertSuccessWithoutWarnings
member.summary: A simple utility method that will assert that this result is successful and that there are no warning messages. This throws an exception if either of those asserts are false.

member.name: P:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult.Failed
member.summary: Did this result fail? If so, you can see the reasons why in `RawMessages`.

member.name: P:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult.Succeeded
member.summary: Was the result a success? Note that even successful operations may have warning messages (`RawMessages`) associated with them.

member.name: P:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult.HasWarnings
member.summary: Does this result have any warnings? This says nothing about if it failed or succeeded, just if it has warning messages associated with it.

member.name: P:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsResult.AsException
member.summary: Utility method to convert the result to an exception. This method is only defined is `Failed` returns true.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.Key_ObjectReference
member.summary: This is an object reference in part of a cyclic graph.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.Key_ObjectDefinition
member.summary: This is an object definition, as part of a cyclic graph.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.Key_InstanceType
member.summary: This specifies the actual type of an object (the instance type was different from the field type).

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.Key_Version
member.summary: The version string for the serialized data.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.Key_Content
member.summary: If we have to add metadata but the original serialized state was not a dictionary, then this will contain the original data.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.IsReservedKeyword(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the given key is a special keyword that full serializer uses to add additional metadata on top of the emitted JSON.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.StripDeserializationMetadata(DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData@)
member.summary: Strips all deserialization metadata from the object, like $type and $content fields.
member.remarks: After making this call, you will *not* be able to deserialize the same object instance. The metadata is strictly necessary for deserialization!

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.ConvertLegacyData(DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData@)
member.summary: This function converts legacy serialization data into the new format, so that the import process can be unified and ignore the old format.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.EnsureDictionary(DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData)
member.summary: Ensures that the data is a dictionary. If it is not, then it is wrapped inside of one.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer._cachedConverters
member.summary: A cache from type to it's converter.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer._cachedProcessors
member.summary: A cache from type to the set of processors that are interested in it.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer._availableConverters
member.summary: Converters that can be used for type registration.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer._availableDirectConverters
member.summary: Direct converters (optimized _converters). We use these so we don't have to perform a scan through every item in _converters and can instead just do an O(1) lookup. This is potentially important to perf when there are a ton of direct converters.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer._processors
member.summary: Processors that are available.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer._references
member.summary: Reference manager for cycle detection.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.Context
member.summary: A context object that fsConverters can use to customize how they operate.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.AddProcessor(DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsObjectProcessor)
member.summary: Add a new processor to the serializer. Multiple processors can run at the same time in the same order they were added in.
member.param: The processor to add.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.GetProcessors(System.Type)
member.summary: Fetches all of the processors for the given type.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.AddConverter(DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsBaseConverter)
member.summary: Adds a new converter that can be used to customize how an object is serialized and deserialized.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.GetConverter(System.Type)
member.summary: Fetches a converter that can serialize/deserialize the given type.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.TrySerialize``1(``0,DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData@)
member.summary: Helper method that simply forwards the call to TrySerialize(typeof(T), instance, out data);

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.TryDeserialize``1(DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData,``0@)
member.summary: Generic wrapper around TryDeserialize that simply forwards the call.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.TrySerialize(System.Type,System.Object,DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData@)
member.summary: Serialize the given value.
member.param: The type of field/property that stores the object instance. This is important particularly for inheritance, as a field storing an IInterface instance should have type information included.
The actual object instance to serialize.
The serialized state of the object.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.TryDeserialize(DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsData,System.Type,System.Object@)
member.summary: Attempts to deserialize a value from a serialized state.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsSerializer.fsLazyCycleDefinitionWriter
member.summary: This manages instance writing so that we do not write unnecessary $id fields. We only need to write out an $id field when there is a corresponding $ref field. This is able to write $id references lazily because the fsData instance is not actually written out to text until we have entirely finished serializing it.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsOption`1
member.summary: Simple option type. This is akin to nullable types.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsPortableReflection
member.summary: This wraps reflection types so that it is portable across different Unity runtimes.

member.summary: Returns true if the given attribute is defined on the given element.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsPortableReflection.HasAttribute``1(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: Returns true if the given attribute is defined on the given element.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsPortableReflection.GetAttribute(System.Reflection.MemberInfo,System.Type)
member.summary: Fetches the given attribute from the given MemberInfo. This method applies caching and is allocation free (after caching has been performed).
member.param: The MemberInfo the get the attribute from.
The type of attribute to fetch.

member.summary: Fetches the given attribute from the given MemberInfo.
member.typeparam: The type of attribute to fetch.
member.param: The MemberInfo to get the attribute from.

member.summary: Returns a pretty name for the type in the style of one that you'd see in C# without the namespace.

member.summary: Returns a pretty name for the type in the style of one that you'd see in C#.

member.summary: A property or field on a MetaType.

member.name: F:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty._memberInfo
member.summary: Internal handle to the reflected member.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty.Write(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Writes a value to the property that this MetaProperty represents, using given object instance as the context.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty.Read(System.Object)
member.summary: Reads a value from the property that this MetaProperty represents, using the given object instance as the context.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty.GetJsonName(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: Returns the name the given member wants to use for JSON serialization.

member.name: P:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty.StorageType
member.summary: The type of value that is stored inside of the property. For example, for an int field, StorageType will be typeof(int).

member.name: P:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty.CanRead
member.summary: Can this property be read?

member.name: P:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty.CanWrite
member.summary: Can this property be written to?

member.name: P:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty.JsonName
member.summary: The serialized name of the property, as it should appear in JSON.

member.name: P:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty.MemberName
member.summary: The name of the actual member.

member.name: P:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsMetaProperty.IsPublic
member.summary: Is this member public?

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsMetaType
member.summary: MetaType contains metadata about a type. This is used by the reflection serializer.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsMetaType.ClearCache
member.summary: Clears out the cached type results. Useful if some prior assumptions become invalid, ie, the default member serialization mode.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsMetaType.CanSerializeProperty(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,System.Reflection.MemberInfo[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns if the given property should be serialized.
member.param: Should a property without any annotations be serialized?

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsMetaType.EmitAotData
member.summary: Attempt to emit an AOT compiled direct converter for this type.
member.returns: True if AOT data was emitted, false otherwise.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsMetaType.CreateInstance
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the type that this metadata points back to. If this type has a default constructor, then Activator.CreateInstance will be used to construct the type (or Array.CreateInstance if it an array). Otherwise, an uninitialized object created via FormatterServices.GetSafeUninitializedObject is used to construct the instance.

member.name: P:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.fsMetaType.HasDefaultConstructor
member.summary: Returns true if the type represented by this metadata contains a default constructor.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsReflectionUtility.GetInterface(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: Searches for a particular implementation of the given interface type inside of the type. This is particularly useful if the interface type is an open type, ie, typeof(IFace{}), because this method will then return IFace{} but with appropriate type parameters inserted.
member.param: The base type to search for interface
The interface type to search for. Can be an open generic type.
member.returns: The actual interface type that the type contains, or null if there is no implementation of the given interfaceType on type.

member.name: T:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsTypeLookup
member.summary: Provides APIs for looking up types based on their name.

member.name: M:DaggerfallWorkshop.FullSerializer.Internal.fsTypeLookup.GetType(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to lookup the given type. Returns null if the type lookup fails.
